Course Section: EPSE_V 408-63D - Educational Programming for Highly Able Learners
Course Section Definition Public Notes:
Online, asynchronous.

Registration will be blocked when the course is full and seats will be filled from the waitlist.
A priority sequence waitlist is available for this course.

For information on waitlists and restrictions for EPSE courses, including when restrictions will be removed, please visit the EPSE Registration Guide at https://pdce.educ.ubc.ca/epse_registration_guide/.

Inquiries: online.educ@ubc.ca

Initial restriction: Specialization SPED (including graduate students), EYED, and IDSC; Program BA, specialization EDUC, emphasis SPED; BEDS, BEEM, CIDSC
Restriction will be removed for DEDU on June 24.
Restriction will be removed for UNCL and EDUC graduate students, BKIN (including BKIN minor) and BSC Integrated Science students and BA/BSC in year: >=3 with one of these specializations: PSYC on July 8.
Restriction will be removed for 3rd and 4th year students and other graduate students on July 26.
Restricted to Special Education Diploma or SPED MA or MEd.

Course Section: EPSE_V 481-074 - Introduction to Research in Education
EPSE_V 482-075 - Introduction to Statistics for Research in Education

Course Section Definition Public Notes: This course will be held in the Room 104 and the UBC Faculty of Arts computer lab in BUCH B202. Registration to this course is restricted to FIPR majors who have completed the re-req FIPR 339.

*Please note, you must register in FIPR 469H 002 as well as 001 in order to complete your registration. 

Acting for Film and Television. Restricted to students registered in the final year of the BFA Acting Program and/or students registered in the BFA Film Production Program. Open only to students who have registered in and completed FIPR 469G.
Please ensure you are registered in the recitation section, FIPR 469H 001.

Course Section Definition Public Notes: Please do not contact the instructor or the department about enrolling in this course if there are no seats available in the course or on the waitlist. Please continue to monitor registration online.

Course Section: FNH_V 483-101 - Dietetics Practice Education Placement IV
FNH_V 497-A_102 - Directed Studies in Food, Nutrition and Health (A)
Course Section Definition Public Notes: To register for this course, students need to first secure a faculty supervisor and work with them to develop a project description and learning outcomes. This should be done well ahead of the terms commencement. Once these steps are completed, students can proceed to submit a course registration form to the course coordinator (fnh.dsat@ubc.ca) for approval.

FNIS 401R Structures of Settler Colonialism: Residential Schools, Indian Hospitals and Child Welfare will be taught by Dr. Tricia Logan. This section is for undergraduate students only. The graduate section is FNIS 501R - please go to https://fnis.arts.ubc.ca/graduate-courses/ for information on registration. If this section is now full, please register on the waitlist of FNIS 401R WL1. If a spot becomes available, we will move students from the waitlist.

Course Section: FREN_V 410-201 - Enlightenment and Revolution: Studies in 18th-c. French Lit
Course Section Definition Public Notes:
An overview of the ideas and values that came to be closely associated with the Age of Enlightenment in France. Question the present-day representation of this period and the weight of its heritage in the current order of knowledge and ideologies.  
View full course overview: https://fhis.ubc.ca/course-description/fren410/  

Language of instruction: French

Contemporary issues and debates on how media and digital technologies have impacted French culture and society. Examines how text, language, and writing are used in digital media.
Full Course Description: https://fhis.ubc.ca/course-description/fren415/ 

Language of instruction: French

Study the different varieties of contemporary French and issues related to French-speaking communities around the world.  
View full course overview: https://fhis.ubc.ca/course-description/fren477/  

Language of instruction: French
